com.mindfusion.scheduling

Class MonthSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mindfusion.scheduling.ViewSettings
      • com.mindfusion.scheduling.MonthSettings

  • public final class MonthSettings
extends ViewSettings
    Defines properties that allow customizing the visualization of months in the SingleMonth and MonthRange views.

    • Method Summary

      • getShowDayOfWeek

        public java.lang.Boolean getShowDayOfWeek()
        Description copied from class: MonthSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether the day names are displayed in the month's header.

        The day names are obtained from the DateTimeInfo object returned by Calendar.getDateTimeInfo().

        Returns:
        true to display day names; otherwise, false.

      • setShowDayOfWeek

        public void setShowDayOfWeek(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: MonthSettings
        Sets a value indicating whether the day names are displayed in the month's header.

        The day names are obtained from the DateTimeInfo object returned by Calendar.getDateTimeInfo().

        Parameters:
        value - true to display day names; otherwise, false. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

        value - One of the MonthWeekHeaderStyle constants or null. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getShowPaddingDays

        public java.lang.Boolean getShowPaddingDays()
        Description copied from class: MonthSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether to display days from the previous and next months at the beginning and the end of the current one, in order to fill the whole grid of day cells.

        Padding days are also displayed in the month range view for the first and the last months contained in the view.

        Returns:
        true to display days from the previous and next months to fill up this month's grid; otherwise, false.

      • setShowPaddingDays

        public void setShowPaddingDays(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: MonthSettings
        Sets a value indicating whether to display days from the previous and next months at the beginning and the end of the current one, in order to fill the whole grid of day cells.

        Padding days are also displayed in the month range view for the first and the last months contained in the view.

        Parameters:
        value - true to display days from the previous and next months to fill up this month's grid; otherwise, false. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getMainHeaderHeight

        public java.lang.Integer getMainHeaderHeight()
        Description copied from class: MonthSettings
        Gets the height of the main header in a month view.

        A value of 0 causes the Calendar component to automatically calculate the header size based on the header font size.

        Returns:
        A non-negative integer value specifying the height of the main header in pixels.

      • getHeaderShadowOffset

        public java.lang.Integer getHeaderShadowOffset()
        Description copied from class: MonthSettings
        Gets the offset of the shadows from the headers that cast them.
        Returns:
        An integer value specifying how many pixels there are between headers and their shadows. The allowed values range from 1 to 5.

      • getFilterWeekends

        public java.lang.Boolean getFilterWeekends()
        Description copied from class: MonthSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether to hide weekend cells.

        This property is ignored if MonthSettings.getCellLayout() is MonthCellLayout.Linear.

        Returns:
        A Boolean value.

      • setFilterWeekends

        public void setFilterWeekends(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: MonthSettings
        Sets a value indicating whether to hide weekend cells.

        This property is ignored if MonthSettings.getCellLayout() is MonthCellLayout.Linear.

        Parameters:
        value - A Boolean value. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getSnapUnit

        public TimeUnit getSnapUnit()
        Description copied from class: MonthSettings
        Gets the snap unit.

        Use this property in a conjunction with MonthSettings.setEnableSnapping(java.lang.Boolean) to specify the precision with which users can move and resize items interactively. If MonthSettings.setEnableSnapping(java.lang.Boolean) is set to false the value of this property is ignored and items snap to cell borders.

        Returns:
        One of the TimeUnit constants.

      • setSnapUnit

        public void setSnapUnit(TimeUnit value)
        Description copied from class: MonthSettings
        Sets the snap unit.

        Use this property in a conjunction with MonthSettings.setEnableSnapping(java.lang.Boolean) to specify the precision with which users can move and resize items interactively. If MonthSettings.setEnableSnapping(java.lang.Boolean) is set to false the value of this property is ignored and items snap to cell borders.

        Parameters:
        value - One of the TimeUnit constants. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getEnableSnapping

        public java.lang.Boolean getEnableSnapping()
        Description copied from class: MonthSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether snapping is enabled.

        When this property is enabled, the users will move and resize items with the precision specified by MonthSettings.getSnapUnit() instead of the precision of the view's resolution. When this property is disabled, the items will snap automatically to the border of their containing cells.

        Returns:
        A Boolean value.

      • setEnableSnapping

        public void setEnableSnapping(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: MonthSettings
        Sets a value indicating whether custom snapping is enabled.

        When this property is enabled, the users will move and resize items with the precision specified by MonthSettings.getSnapUnit() instead of the precision of the view's resolution. When this property is disabled, the items will snap automatically to the border of their containing cells.

        Parameters:
        value - A Boolean value. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getEnableLanes

        public java.lang.Boolean getEnableLanes()
        Description copied from class: MonthSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether the view should take into consideration the lanes associated with item.
        Returns:
        A Boolean value.

      • setEnableLanes

        public void setEnableLanes(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: MonthSettings
        Sets a value indicating whether the view should take into consideration the lanes associated with item.
        Parameters:
        value - A Boolean value. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.
